w:r.w:t: The teacher will teach basic greetings and introductions by using TPR, sentence frames, and vocabulary. Students will study these words and phrases:
I see a family, brother, sister, baby, grandma, grandpa, love, eat, play, read, like
At completion of this lesson, students will be able to:
Recognize, spell, and pronounce the words for family
Spell and pronounce common associated words
Use sets of words in complete sentences
Word List: see, family, brother, sister, baby, grandma, grandpa, love, eat, play, read, like
This slide will always be the
-branded opener slide that the teacher will display as the student enters the classroom.
Greet your student and introduce the lesson concept: “Today, we are going to be learning about family!
Put your hands to your heart each time the word love is said.
Teacher should say the chant in the picture above. TPR: Each time the word,
is said, the teacher should put her hands over her heart and have a loving face. Repeat the chant and encourage the child to hug his or herself as well. Circle the word
to make the connection to text.
Visual cues: Teacher can show other pictures of families.

Say the name of people in the family that the teacher circles and use the word in a complete sentence:
Teacher will make a circle gesture with her finger to encourage the student to circle people in the picture in random order.
Teacher will circle one person in the picture. The teacher w
ill ask, “Who is it?” with TPR and facial expressions. Encourage child to answer who it is in complete sentences – Example: “This is _________.”
Do the action for love (hand over heart)
TPR: Model and act out the word
by putting your hands over your heart and making a loving face. Re
several times. Encourage the child to complete the action by gesturing gently at them and repeating the action.
Say the sentence on the screen with the action and prompt student to do the same. Underline the sentence as you say it.

the word “together” and circle the family
TPR: The teacher will model the word,
while acting out a hand motion and saying the word
Encourage the child to do the same.
Model the word “together” by underlining the word and explaining that the family eats as a group
Complete the sentence frame: “We eat together as a family.”
TPR: The teacher will model the eating action again. Encourage the child to do the same.
Complete the sentence frame: “We play together as a family.”
Do the action for the word,
(pretend to play with playing cards, or use a prop)
TPR: The teacher will model the word,
while acting out a hand motion of playing cards and saying the word
Encourage the child to do the same.
Visual cue: The teacher should have playing cards as a prop to model the word play while shuffling, showing, and using the playing cards (like s
he is pretending to play a game)
Circle a picture of someone playing and have the child do the same.
Hold up four fingers and spell the word,
we play together as a family
as you say this phrase and circle the picture of the family
when you get to that word in the phrase.
Instruct student to circle certain family members.
Complete the sentence frame by circling the appropriate family members and circling or drawing a line to the sight word
“I like to play with my sister, brother, grandfather”
Put an X through the word “baby”
prompting the student to circle or draw lines from the sight word to the picture of each family member
on the screen and encourage the student to do the same.
Instruct student to circle certain members of the family
Call special attention to “baby” and prompt the student about whether the baby is seen in the picture
Do the action for the word,
(pretend to read by pretending to hold a book)
Write or say the words “loves” and “read” on the slide
Visual cue: Have props to model the verb,
and have the child do the same
Circle someone reading and have the child circle another person reading
TPR: Model and act out the word
by putting your hands over your heart and making a loving face.

I like to play with my family
I like to read with my family

Freeform “Show and Tell” Conversation Activity Slide
Students should have a blank slide to draw a picture of
see, family, brother, sister, baby, grandma, grandpa, love, eat, play, read, like
see, family, brother, sister, baby, grandma, grandpa, love, eat, pla
Teacher will prompt student to draw a picture to represent
see, family, brother, sister, baby, grandma, grandpa, love, eat, play, read, like
through pictures. One prompt at a time.
Teacher will write words from the lesson (
e, family, brother, sister, baby, grandma, grandpa, love, eat, play, read, like)
Word Wall Vocabulary Builder Activity – Slide 22
Students will read and spell their new words:
I, family, together, love, eat, play, read, mother, father, brother, sister, baby, grandmother, grandfather, mom, dad, grandma, grandpa
Teacher will give feedback on the spelling and pronunciation of the new words.
